metadata.title: рджрд╛рджрд╛рд╕ рдкрддреНрд░ (Letter to Elder Brother)
metadata.subject: Marathi
metadata.description: An informal Marathi letter written by a student named Ayesha to her elder brother (Dada) about a school picnic to the Malhok (Maldhok) Bird Sanctuary (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп) near Nannaj village on the Solapur-Barshi route. The chapter teaches the format of informal Marathi letters and introduces the Great Indian Bustard (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ), an endangered bird that is Maharashtra's state bird. The chapter also covers types of communication: one-way (рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА) and two-way (рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА) communication.

preAssessment.question: What is the Marathi name for the Great Indian Bustard (a large endangered bird)?
In a Marathi informal letter, what is the correct greeting at the start?
The Malhok Bird Sanctuary is located near which village?
Which of these is an example of 'рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА' (one-way) communication?

options.B: Having a conversation face to face
options.D: Sending an email and receiving a reply

preAssessment.question: Why is the Great Indian Bustard (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ) considered a friend of farmers?

options.A: It helps farmers plough the fields
options.B: It eats insects and pests that harm crops
options.C: It brings rain to the fields
options.D: It guards the farm from animals

concepts.title: The Malhok Bird Sanctuary
concepts.content: The Malhok (Maldhok) Bird Sanctuary, officially called 'рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп' (Maldhok Abhayaranya), is located near Nannaj village on the Solapur-Barshi road in the Solapur district of Maharashtra. It was established specifically to protect the Great Indian Bustard тАФ the 'рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ' тАФ one of the world's most endangered birds. The sanctuary covers the open grassland (рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди) habitat that this bird needs to survive. The region around Nannaj is dry, flat, and open тАФ perfect for the Maldhok, which is a grassland bird. It is one of the few places in India where you can still see this magnificent bird.

examples.text: Location: Nannaj village, Solapur district, Maharashtra тАФ on the Solapur-Barshi road (National Highway area).
The sanctuary protects open grassland (рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди) тАФ the flat, dry, open habitat that Maldhok needs.
School picnics to wildlife sanctuaries are an important part of environmental education in Maharashtra.
The Great Indian Bustard is so important that there is a national conservation program to save it from extinction.

keyPoints: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп (Maldhok Bird Sanctuary) is near Nannaj village, Solapur district, Maharashtra.
It is established specifically to protect the Great Indian Bustard (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ bird).
'рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп' means sanctuary тАФ a protected area where animals/birds are safe from hunting and disturbance.
The sanctuary covers dry, open grassland (рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди) тАФ the natural habitat of the рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ.
Solapur district is in eastern Maharashtra тАФ a dry, semi-arid region known for its textile industry.
concepts.funFact: The word 'рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди' in Marathi means the open, flat, grassy plateau тАФ a specific type of landscape found in parts of Maharashtra and Karnataka. This habitat is disappearing fast due to farming and construction, which is why the рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ is endangered!
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 5, Pages 14-16 тАФ Maharashtra Board 7th Grade Marathi (Second Language)

concepts.title: The рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ Bird тАФ Great Indian Bustard
concepts.content: The рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ (Great Indian Bustard) is one of the world's heaviest flying birds and is critically endangered тАФ there are fewer than 150 left in India! It is known as the 'рд░рд╛рдЬреНрдпрдкрдХреНрд╖реА' (state bird) of Rajasthan, and is similarly protected in Maharashtra. The bird is a natural friend of farmers (рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░) because it eats insects, grasshoppers, lizards, and rodents that damage crops тАФ free pest control! However, it lays only one egg per year, making its population recovery very slow. Threats include: loss of grassland habitat, electricity power lines (birds die from collisions), pesticides, and hunting. Conservation programs in Rajasthan and Maharashtra aim to protect the remaining birds.

examples.text: The рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ eats insects and pests тАФ protecting crops naturally without chemical pesticides.
It lays only one egg per year тАФ so population growth is extremely slow, making recovery from low numbers very hard.
Power lines are a major danger тАФ Maldhok birds cannot see them and die from collisions while flying.
Critically Endangered: fewer than 150 Great Indian Bustards left in India тАФ it is near extinction.

keyPoints: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ = Great Indian Bustard тАФ one of the world's heaviest flying birds.
It is critically endangered тАФ fewer than 150 remain in India (mainly Rajasthan and Maharashtra).
It is a farmer's friend (рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░) тАФ it naturally controls insects and pests.
It lays only 1 egg per year тАФ very slow reproduction makes conservation urgent.
Threats: grassland loss, power line collisions, pesticides, hunting in past decades.
concepts.funFact: The Great Indian Bustard was once a candidate for India's National Bird! Eventually the Peacock (рдореЛрд░) was chosen instead. Had the Bustard been chosen, it might have received more protection and funding earlier. Scientists say that if the Bustard goes extinct, it would be a major ecological loss for India's grassland ecosystems.
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 5, Page 15 тАФ The Maldhok bird

concepts.title: Importance of Birds to Ecology
concepts.content: Birds (рдкрдХреНрд╖реА) play a vital role in maintaining ecological balance (рдкрд░реНрдпрд╛рд╡рд░рдг рд░рдХреНрд╖рдг). Their roles include: (1) Pest control тАФ many birds eat insects, rodents, and pests; (2) Pollination тАФ birds like sunbirds carry pollen from flower to flower; (3) Seed dispersal тАФ birds eat fruits and spread seeds through their droppings; (4) Scavenging тАФ vultures (рдЧрд┐рдзрд╛рдб) clean up dead animals, preventing disease; (5) Indicator species тАФ the health of bird populations tells scientists how healthy an ecosystem is. When bird populations decline (like the рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ), it signals that the entire ecosystem is under stress.

examples.text: Pest control: Sparrows, mynas, and Maldhok eat insects тАФ farmers benefit from bird presence near their fields.
Pollination: Sunbirds (рд╕реБрд░реНрдпрдкрдХреНрд╖реА) and hummingbirds transfer pollen, helping flowers produce fruits and seeds.
Seed dispersal: When birds eat berries and fly away, seeds are spread to new areas тАФ helping forests grow.
Scavenging: Vultures eat carcasses of dead animals тАФ they are nature's garbage disposal, preventing disease spread.

keyPoints: Birds perform crucial ecological roles: pest control, pollination, seed dispersal, and scavenging.
Losing bird species disrupts food chains and ecosystem balance тАФ each extinction has ripple effects.
India has over 1,300 species of birds тАФ one of the most bird-rich countries in the world.
Bird watching (рдкрдХреНрд╖реА рдирд┐рд░реАрдХреНрд╖рдг) is a growing hobby in Maharashtra тАФ Thane, Pune, and Nashik areas are popular spots.
Maharashtra has several bird sanctuaries: Karnala, Bhigwan, Nannaj (Maldhok), Koyana тАФ all worth visiting.
concepts.funFact: The Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary in Goa and the Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary in Rajasthan are among India's most famous bird reserves. Dr. Salim Ali (1896тАУ1987) was born in Mumbai and became India's greatest ornithologist (bird scientist) тАФ his bird books are still used by scientists worldwide!

concepts.title: Marathi Informal Letter Format
concepts.content: An informal letter (рдЕрдиреМрдкрдЪрд╛рд░рд┐рдХ рдкрддреНрд░) in Marathi to a friend, sibling, or family member has a specific format: (1) Place and Date (рдард┐рдХрд╛рдг рдЖрдгрд┐ рддрд╛рд░реАрдЦ) тАФ top right corner; (2) Salutation/Greeting: 'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп (name),' followed by 'рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░' (affectionate greetings) or 'рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдЖрд╢реАрд░реНрд╡рд╛рдж' (from elders to younger); (3) Opening line тАФ reason for writing; (4) Body of letter тАФ main content; (5) Closing line; (6) Sign-off: 'рддреБрдЭреА рдмрд╣реАрдг / рддреБрдЭрд╛ рднрд╛рдК / рддреБрдЭрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░' (your sister/brother/friend); (7) Name. In the chapter, Ayesha writes to her 'рджрд╛рджрд╛' (elder brother) about the picnic to Maldhok Sanctuary.

examples.text: Date format in Marathi: рджрд┐рдирд╛рдВрдХ: реирел рдЬрд╛рдиреЗрд╡рд╛рд░реА, реирежреирел тАФ written at the top right of the letter.
Greeting: 'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп рджрд╛рджрд╛, рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░' тАФ 'Dear Elder Brother, with affectionate greetings.'
Body: Describe the event (picnic), what you saw, felt, and learned тАФ in paragraphs.
Sign-off: 'рддреБрдЭреА рдмрд╣реАрдг, (Name)' тАФ 'Your sister, Ayesha' тАФ always include your relationship and name.

keyPoints: Marathi informal letter format: Date тЖТ Greeting (рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп + name) тЖТ рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░ тЖТ Body тЖТ Sign-off тЖТ Name.
'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп' = dear (used for friends and equals); 'рдкреВрдЬреНрдп' or 'рдЖрджрд░рдгреАрдп' = used for elders or formal letters.
'рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░' = affectionate greetings; 'рд╕рд╛рджрд░ рдкреНрд░рдгрд╛рдо' = respectful regards (for elders).
Sign-off shows relationship: 'рддреБрдЭреА рдмрд╣реАрдг' (your sister), 'рддреБрдЭрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░' (your friend), 'рддреБрдЭрд╛ рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛' (your son).
Informal letters in Marathi use friendly, conversational language тАФ unlike formal letters which are more structured.
concepts.funFact: In Maharashtra, letter writing (рдкрддреНрд░ рд▓реЗрдЦрди) remains an important part of school education even in the digital age! While emails and WhatsApp are common today, knowing how to write a proper Marathi letter is considered an important cultural skill. PрддреНрд░ lekhan is tested in every Maharashtra Board Marathi exam!
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 5, Pages 15-16 тАФ Marathi letter writing format

concepts.title: Communication Types: рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА vs рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА
concepts.content: Communication (рд╕рдВрд╡рд╛рдж / рд╕рдВрдкреНрд░реЗрд╖рдг) can be divided into two types based on the direction of information flow: (1) рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (Ektarfi / One-way): Information flows in ONE direction only тАФ the sender sends, the receiver receives, but cannot immediately respond. Examples: Radio broadcast, newspaper, television program, a speech in front of an audience. (2) рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (Dutarfi / Two-way): Information flows in BOTH directions тАФ both parties can send and receive, making it an exchange. Examples: Mobile phone call, face-to-face conversation (рд╕рдВрднрд╛рд╖рдг), email with reply, video call, letter exchange. Understanding this helps us think about how effectively we communicate.

examples.text: рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (One-way): Radio broadcast тАФ you can hear but cannot talk back to the radio presenter!
рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (One-way): Newspaper тАФ the writer writes, you read, but you cannot immediately respond.
рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (Two-way): Mobile phone call тАФ you speak AND listen, creating a real exchange of information.
рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (Two-way): Face-to-face conversation тАФ the most complete form of two-way communication.

keyPoints: рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА = one-way communication: sender тЖТ receiver (no immediate feedback possible).
Examples of one-way: radio, newspaper, speech, television program, poster, pamphlet.
рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА = two-way communication: sender тЖФ receiver (both can send and receive).
Examples of two-way: mobile call, conversation, email exchange, letter-reply, video call.
A letter (рдкрддреНрд░) by itself is one-way, but when the recipient replies, together they form two-way communication.
concepts.funFact: Social media platforms like Instagram or YouTube comments are interesting examples тАФ a post is рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (one-way), but when people comment and the creator replies, it becomes рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (two-way)! The rise of interactive media has transformed communication from mostly one-way to more two-way in recent decades.

test.question: What is the 'рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ' bird known as in English?
test.explanation: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ is the Marathi name for the Great Indian Bustard тАФ one of the world's heaviest flying birds. It is critically endangered with fewer than 150 individuals remaining in India. The Maldhok Bird Sanctuary near Nannaj, Solapur is one of the few places where this bird can still be found.

test.question: In which district of Maharashtra is the Malhok Bird Sanctuary located?
test.explanation: The Maldhok Bird Sanctuary is located near Nannaj village in Solapur district, Maharashtra, on the Solapur-Barshi road. Solapur is in eastern Maharashtra тАФ a semi-arid region. The dry, open grassland (рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди) in this area is the perfect habitat for the Great Indian Bustard.

test.question: Why is the рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ (Great Indian Bustard) called 'рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░' (farmer's friend)?

options.B: It eats insects and pests that damage crops
options.C: It brings rain to the fields
options.D: It scares away predators from the farm

test.explanation: The рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ eats insects, grasshoppers, lizards, and rodents тАФ all of which can damage crops. By eating these pests naturally, the bird helps protect crops without the need for chemical pesticides. This is why it is called 'рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░' (farmer's friend).

test.question: In the Marathi informal letter format, what comes immediately after 'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп рджрд╛рджрд╛'?
test.explanation: In an informal Marathi letter, after the greeting 'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп (name),' the next line is 'рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░' тАФ meaning 'with affectionate greetings.' This phrase is used when writing to someone of equal or younger age (friend, sibling). For elders, 'рд╕рд╛рджрд░ рдкреНрд░рдгрд╛рдо' or 'рд╕рд╛рджрд░ рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░' is used.

test.question: How many eggs does the Great Indian Bustard (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ) lay per year?
test.explanation: The Great Indian Bustard lays only one egg per year. This extremely slow reproduction rate makes it very difficult for the population to recover from low numbers. Even if conservation measures succeed, population growth is very gradual тАФ making every individual bird precious.

test.question: Which of the following is an example of рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (two-way) communication?
test.explanation: A mobile phone conversation is рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (two-way) communication because BOTH people can speak and listen тАФ information flows in both directions. Watching TV, reading newspapers, and listening to speeches are all рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (one-way) because the audience cannot immediately respond to the sender.

test.question: The Marathi word 'рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп' (abhayaranya) means:
test.explanation: 'рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп' = рдЕрднрдп (fearlessness/safety) + рдЕрд░рдгреНрдп (forest/wild area). So it means a place where wild animals or birds can live without fear of being hunted or disturbed тАФ a protected sanctuary. It is different from a zoo (where animals are kept in captivity) тАФ in an рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп, animals live freely in their natural habitat.

test.question: In Ayesha's letter, how does she sign off?
test.explanation: Ayesha signs her letter as 'рддреБрдЭреА рдмрд╣реАрдг, рдЖрдпреЗрд╢рд╛' тАФ meaning 'Your sister, Ayesha.' This is the correct sign-off for an informal Marathi letter written to an elder brother. The sign-off always shows the writer's relationship to the recipient and ends with the writer's name.

test.question: What is a major threat to the Great Indian Bustard (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ) population?

options.B: Power line collisions and habitat loss

test.explanation: Two major threats to the рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ are: (1) Collisions with power lines тАФ the bird cannot see the thin wires and dies from impact; and (2) Habitat loss тАФ the open grasslands (рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди) the bird needs are being converted to farmland and built-up areas. Together, these have reduced the population to fewer than 150 birds in India.

test.question: Radio broadcasting is an example of which type of communication?
test.explanation: Radio broadcasting is рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (one-way) communication тАФ the radio station broadcasts a program and listeners can only receive the message. They cannot immediately talk back to the presenter during the broadcast. Other one-way examples: TV programs, newspapers, speeches, posters.

keyConcepts: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ = Great Indian Bustard тАФ critically endangered bird of Maharashtra
рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп тАФ Nannaj village, Solapur district, Maharashtra
Marathi informal letter format: Date, рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп, рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░, body, sign-off
рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА = two-way communication (mobile, conversation, email exchange)
рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░ = farmer's friend (role of birds in pest control)
рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп = wildlife sanctuary тАФ protected area for animals/birds
рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди = open grassland plateau тАФ habitat of the Maldhok bird
commonMisconceptions: Students may confuse 'рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп' (sanctuary) with 'рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рдЙрджреНрдпрд╛рди' (national park) тАФ both are protected areas but with different levels of protection and regulations.
Some students think email is always two-way тАФ technically, sending an email without a reply is one-way. It becomes two-way only when there is an exchange.
Students may confuse 'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп' (dear, for equals/friends) with 'рдЖрджрд░рдгреАрдп/рдкреВрдЬреНрдп' (respected, for elders/formal letters).
The Maldhok is sometimes confused with the Malabar bird or other large birds тАФ it is specifically the Great Indian Bustard.
realWorldExamples: Maharashtra's Project Bustard: The Maharashtra Forest Department and central government run special programs to protect the remaining рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ birds in Solapur.
Radio Mirchi, All India Radio (Akashvani) тАФ popular Marathi radio stations that are classic examples of рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА communication.
Doordarshan Sahyadri тАФ Marathi TV channel тАФ another рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА communication medium that broadcasts educational programs.
Bhigwan (near Pune) тАФ another famous bird watching spot in Maharashtra, famous for flamingos.

interactiveElement.title: Unscramble the Word!
interactiveElement.description: Rearrange the letters to form the correct Marathi vocabulary word.

words.hint: рдорд╣рд╛рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░рд╛рддреАрд▓ рдПрдХ рдкреНрд░рд╕рд┐рджреНрдз рд╕рдорд╛рдЬ (A famous community of Maharashtra)

textbookExercise.instructions: Memorize these exam-style answers to maximize scoring in textbook-focused assessments.

qaCards.question: What is the 'рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ' bird known as in English?
qaCards.answer: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ is the Marathi name for the Great Indian Bustard тАФ one of the world's heaviest flying birds. It is critically endangered with fewer than 150 individuals remaining in India. The Maldhok Bird Sanctuary near Nannaj, Solapur is one of the few places where this bird can still be found.

qaCards.question: In which district of Maharashtra is the Malhok Bird Sanctuary located?
qaCards.answer: The Maldhok Bird Sanctuary is located near Nannaj village in Solapur district, Maharashtra, on the Solapur-Barshi road. Solapur is in eastern Maharashtra тАФ a semi-arid region. The dry, open grassland (рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди) in this area is the perfect habitat for the Great Indian Bustard.

qaCards.question: Why is the рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ (Great Indian Bustard) called 'рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░' (farmer's friend)?
qaCards.answer: The рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ eats insects, grasshoppers, lizards, and rodents тАФ all of which can damage crops. By eating these pests naturally, the bird helps protect crops without the need for chemical pesticides. This is why it is called 'рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░' (farmer's friend).

qaCards.question: In the Marathi informal letter format, what comes immediately after 'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп рджрд╛рджрд╛'?
qaCards.answer: In an informal Marathi letter, after the greeting 'рдкреНрд░рд┐рдп (name),' the next line is 'рд╕рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░' тАФ meaning 'with affectionate greetings.' This phrase is used when writing to someone of equal or younger age (friend, sibling). For elders, 'рд╕рд╛рджрд░ рдкреНрд░рдгрд╛рдо' or 'рд╕рд╛рджрд░ рдирдорд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░' is used.

qaCards.question: How many eggs does the Great Indian Bustard (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ) lay per year?
qaCards.answer: The Great Indian Bustard lays only one egg per year. This extremely slow reproduction rate makes it very difficult for the population to recover from low numbers. Even if conservation measures succeed, population growth is very gradual тАФ making every individual bird precious.

qaCards.question: Which of the following is an example of рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (two-way) communication?
qaCards.answer: A mobile phone conversation is рджреБрддрд░реНрдлреА (two-way) communication because BOTH people can speak and listen тАФ information flows in both directions. Watching TV, reading newspapers, and listening to speeches are all рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (one-way) because the audience cannot immediately respond to the sender.

qaCards.question: The Marathi word 'рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп' (abhayaranya) means:
qaCards.answer: 'рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп' = рдЕрднрдп (fearlessness/safety) + рдЕрд░рдгреНрдп (forest/wild area). So it means a place where wild animals or birds can live without fear of being hunted or disturbed тАФ a protected sanctuary. It is different from a zoo (where animals are kept in captivity) тАФ in an рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдп, animals live freely in their natural habitat.

qaCards.question: In Ayesha's letter, how does she sign off?
qaCards.answer: Ayesha signs her letter as 'рддреБрдЭреА рдмрд╣реАрдг, рдЖрдпреЗрд╢рд╛' тАФ meaning 'Your sister, Ayesha.' This is the correct sign-off for an informal Marathi letter written to an elder brother. The sign-off always shows the writer's relationship to the recipient and ends with the writer's name.

qaCards.question: What is a major threat to the Great Indian Bustard (рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ) population?
qaCards.answer: Two major threats to the рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ are: (1) Collisions with power lines тАФ the bird cannot see the thin wires and dies from impact; and (2) Habitat loss тАФ the open grasslands (рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рди) the bird needs are being converted to farmland and built-up areas. Together, these have reduced the population to fewer than 150 birds in India.

qaCards.question: Radio broadcasting is an example of which type of communication?
qaCards.answer: Radio broadcasting is рдПрдХрддрд░реНрдлреА (one-way) communication тАФ the radio station broadcasts a program and listeners can only receive the message. They cannot immediately talk back to the presenter during the broadcast. Other one-way examples: TV programs, newspapers, speeches, posters.

longAnswers.modelAnswer: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдкрдХреНрд╖реА рдкреНрд░рд╛рдореБрдЦреНрдпрд╛рдиреЗ рд╢реЗрддрд╛рддреАрд▓ рдкрд┐рдХрд╛рдВрдЪреЗ рдиреБрдХрд╕рд╛рди рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛ рдХрд┐рдбреЗ, рдЯреЛрд│, рд╕рд░рдбреЗ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдЙрдВрджреАрд░ рдЕрд╢рд╛ рдЙрдкрджреНрд░рд╡реА рдЬреАрд╡рд╛рдВрдирд╛ рдЦрд╛рддреЛ. рд╣рд╛ рдкрдХреНрд╖реА рдХреЛрдгрддреНрдпрд╛рд╣реА рд░рд╛рд╕рд╛рдпрдирд┐рдХ рдХреАрдбрдирд╛рд╢рдХрд╛рдВрдЪрд╛ рд╡рд╛рдкрд░ рди рдХрд░рддрд╛ рдиреИрд╕рд░реНрдЧрд┐рдХрд░рд┐рддреНрдпрд╛ рдХреАрдб рдирд┐рдпрдВрддреНрд░рдг рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреЗ рдорд╣рддреНрддреНрд╡рд╛рдЪреЗ рдХрд╛рдо рдХрд░рддреЛ. рдпрд╛рдореБрд│реЗ рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдкрд┐рдХрд╛рдЪреЗ рдиреИрд╕рд░реНрдЧрд┐рдХрд░рд┐рддреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрд░рдХреНрд╖рдг рд╣реЛрддреЗ рдЖрдгрд┐ рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪрд╛ рд╢реЗрддреАрд╡рд░реАрд▓ рдЕрдирд╛рд╡рд╢реНрдпрдХ рдЦрд░реНрдЪрд╣реА рд╡рд╛рдЪрддреЛ. рдкрд┐рдХрд╛рдВрдЪреЗ рд░рдХреНрд╖рдг рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдпрд╛ рдореЛрд▓рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рднреВрдорд┐рдХреЗрдореБрд│реЗрдЪ рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдкрдХреНрд╖реНрдпрд╛рд▓рд╛ 'рд╢реЗрддрдХрд▒реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд┐рддреНрд░' рдЕрд╕реЗ рд╕рдВрдмреЛрдзрд▓реЗ рдЬрд╛рддреЗ.

longAnswers.question: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдкрдХреНрд╖реНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рдорд╣рддреНрддреНрд╡рд╛рдЪреА рд╡реИрд╢рд┐рд╖реНрдЯреНрдпреЗ рд╕рд╛рдВрдЧрд╛. (State the important characteristics of the Maldhok bird.)
longAnswers.modelAnswer: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рд╣рд╛ рдЬрдЧрд╛рддреАрд▓ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рд╡рдЬрдирджрд╛рд░ рдЙрдбрдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛ рдкрдХреНрд╖реНрдпрд╛рдВрдкреИрдХреА рдПрдХ рдЕрд╕реВрди рддреЛ рдЕрддрд┐рд╢рдп рджреЗрдЦрдгрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд░реБрдмрд╛рдмрджрд╛рд░ рджрд┐рд╕рддреЛ. рд╣рд╛ рдкрдХреНрд╖реА рдкреНрд░рд╛рдореБрдЦреНрдпрд╛рдиреЗ рдХреЛрд░рдбреНрдпрд╛ рдорд╛рд│рд░рд╛рдирд╛рд╡рд░ рдХрд┐рдВрд╡рд╛ рд╡рд┐рд╕реНрддреАрд░реНрдг рдЧрд╡рддрд╛рд│ рдкреНрд░рджреЗрд╢рд╛рдд рд░рд╛рд╣рдгреЗ рдкрд╕рдВрдд рдХрд░рддреЛ. рдпрд╛ рдкрдХреНрд╖реНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рдореЛрдареА рдорд░реНрдпрд╛рджрд╛ рдореНрд╣рдгрдЬреЗ рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдкрдХреНрд╖реНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рдорд╛рджреА рд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рдХрд╛рдареА рдХреЗрд╡рд│ рдПрдХрдЪ рдЕрдВрдбреЗ рдШрд╛рд▓рддреЗ, рддреНрдпрд╛рдореБрд│реЗ рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреА рд╕рдВрдЦреНрдпрд╛ рд╡рд╛рдврдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╡реЗрдЧ рдордВрдж рдЖрд╣реЗ. рд╣рд╛ рдкрдХреНрд╖реА рд╕рдзреНрдпрд╛ рдЕрддреНрдпрдВрдд рджреБрд░реНрдорд┐рд│ рдЭрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдЕрд╕реВрди рддреЛ рд░рд╛рдЬрд╕реНрдерд╛рдирдЪрд╛ рд░рд╛рдЬреНрдпрдкрдХреНрд╖реА рдЖрд╣реЗ.

longAnswers.question: рдЖрдпреЗрд╢рд╛рдиреЗ рджрд╛рджрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдкрддреНрд░ рд▓рд┐рд╣рд┐рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреЗ рдореБрдЦреНрдп рдХрд╛рд░рдг рдХрд╛рдп рд╣реЛрддреЗ? (What was the main reason Ayesha wrote a letter to her brother?)
longAnswers.modelAnswer: рдЖрдпреЗрд╢рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╢рд╛рд│реЗрдЪреА рд╕рд╣рд▓ рд╕реЛрд▓рд╛рдкреВрд░-рдмрд╛рд░реНрд╢реА рдорд╛рд░реНрдЧрд╛рд╡рд░реАрд▓ 'рдирд╛рдиреНрдирдЬ' рдпреЗрдереАрд▓ рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЧреЗрд▓реА рд╣реЛрддреА. рддрд┐рдереЗ рддрд┐рдиреЗ рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдкрдХреНрд╖реА рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпрдХреНрд╖ рдкрд╛рд╣рд┐рд▓рд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЬреАрд╡рдирд╢реИрд▓реАрдмрджреНрджрд▓ рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдХрд╛рдВрдХрдбреВрди рдЦреВрдк рд░рдВрдЬрдХ рдорд╛рд╣рд┐рддреА рдорд┐рд│рд╡рд▓реА. рд╣рд╛ рдЕрднрдпрд╛рд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рддреАрд▓ рдЕрд╡рд┐рд╕реНрдорд░рдгреАрдп рдЕрдиреБрднрд╡ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдорд┐рд│рд╡рд▓реЗрд▓рд╛ рдЖрдирдВрдж рдЖрдкрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рджрд╛рджрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдХрд│рд╡рдгреНрдпрд╛рд╕рд╛рдареА рддрд┐рдиреЗ рд╣реЗ рдкрддреНрд░ рд▓рд┐рд╣рд┐рд▓реЗ. рддрд╕реЗрдЪ, рддрд┐рдиреЗ рдкрддреНрд░рд╛рджреНрд╡рд╛рд░реЗ рджрд╛рджрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдпреЗрддреНрдпрд╛ рд╕реБрдЯреНрдЯреАрдд рдШрд░реА рдпреЗрдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреЗ рдХрд│рдХрд│реАрдЪреЗ рдЖрд╡рд╛рд╣рдирд╣реА рдХреЗрд▓реЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ.

longAnswers.question: рдорд╛рд│рдвреЛрдХ рдкрдХреНрд╖реНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЕрд╕реНрддрд┐рддреНрд╡рд╛рдкреБрдвреАрд▓ рдзреЛрдХреЗ рдХреЛрдгрддреЗ рдЖрд╣реЗрдд? (What are the threats to the survival of Maldhok birds?)
